list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was forsaken by his friends.

list_ex_of_english: Many of our elderly people feel concerned and forsaken.
Commercial traffic may have forsaken a waterway for good.
Because of it, a man often forsakes his own view and accepts the view of the group.
The small suburb, conveniently located on a transport crossroad, turned into an urban centre of finance, commerce and manufacturing, gradually forsaking its 'garden city' characteristics.
They would not have forsaken it if they had thought it would be successful.
Since doctors seem to be forsaking conventional treatment for prescription by telephone, the practice could develop systematically over the years and might not be just an emergency procedure.
The remarkable thing about these books is that they can entertain such emotions without forsaking their attempt to give as humanly circumstantial an impression of this lost world as possible.
He should not be termed a coward, for forsaking his wife.
